title: Sleepwalker told to warn anyone he sleeps with of his 'sexsomnia'
text:

A man cleared of molesting a pal's girlfriend after sleepwalking into their bedroom was today ordered to notify anyone he spends the night with of his "sexsomnia".

Apprentice electrician Dale Kelly, 21, was cleared of sexual assault by penetration by reason of insanity six weeks ago.

He sobbed in the dock at York Crown Court after jurors accepted he was suffering from the sleeping disorder parasomnia when he climbed into the couple's bed.

However, after the verdict in August, Judge Simon Hickey underlined that doctors on the case believed Kelly's "mental disorder" needed treatment.

Yesterday the court heard he not only suffers from parasomnia but the even rarer condition of sexsomnia - sexual activity during sleep.

(Image: PA)

Judge Hickey said this meant he posed a threat not only to the girl he performed a sex act on but women in general.

The judge underlined Kelly has had to walk up two flights of stairs before getting into bed with the couple.

He imposed a five year sexual harm prevention order.

Kelly was banned from ever contacting the girl in question.

And whenever he sleeps away he must tell everyone in the house of his "affliction", the judge said.

This would enable anyone else in the house to take whatever steps they needed "to protect themselves".

The judge told Kelly: "I judge you do pose a risk to the victim and any female who might find themselves sleeping under the same roof.

"As a young man, these factors could easily occur again."

Eleanor Fry, defending, questioned whether the order was needed but the judge said it was.

Kelly was also made the subject of a two year supervision order to include awareness courses for alcohol and other possible trigger factors for his condition.

The law says if someone totally lacks control of their body while committing a crime they can be cleared.

(Image: PA Archive/Press Association Images)

But those found not guilty in such circumstances can be ordered by the judge to be admitted to hospital.

But the court heard that experts agreed there could be no benefits from placing Kelly on a psychiatric ward.

It was also agreed he could not be barred from working with children or vulnerable people because he had not been convicted of anything.

He left court with his mum who said: "Whatever the outcome there are no winners here."

Kelly was accused of touching the girl, who cannot be named, intimately after getting into bed with her and his pal in April 2017.

He was staying in a spare room at the friend's home, after a boozy night out clubbing.

But he later got up and made his way to the second floor before climbing into bed with the girl and his mate.

His friend suddenly woke moments later as his girlfriend repeatedly screamed: "What the f*** is he doing in our bed?"

Kelly got out of bed and looked back at the couple before insisting he had been dreaming he was in bed with another woman he was dating.

He left the property before being arrested and later texted a friend: "I have done it before with a lad.

"Sometimes when I'm drunk I do things in my sleep. I was in bed with one of my mates and apparently I have tried to grab his cock.

"You do not know how scared I am to be in bed with a girl."

Other male friends described Kelly engaging in "sex talk" with them on the phone as he slept.
description: Dale Kelly, 21, poses a threat not only to the girl he performed a sex act on but women in general, a judge at York Crown Court said
